what: Feedback Message Utility Functions - msg_ — feedback
title: Feedback Message Utility Functions - msg_ — feedback
text: set helper functions providing verbose feedback developer using functions prefixed msg_ (.e. msg_error, msg_warning, msg_success).

title: Feedback Message Utility Functions - msg_ — feedback
code: msg_field(x)  msg_value(x)  msg_done(x)  msg_bullet(x, bullet = cli::symbol$bullet)  msg_err(x)  msg_path(x)  msg_info(x)  msg_code(x)  msg_feedback(x)

title: Feedback Message Utility Functions - msg_ — feedback
text: x string passed various msg_ functions. bullet use message's bullet. Defaults cli::symbol$bullet

title: Feedback Message Utility Functions - msg_ — feedback
text: See use_feedback_helpers() add functions package!

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

title: Set Foreign Key — set_foreign_key
text: Creates FOREIGN KEY REFERENCES constraint specified key referencing foreign_table's foreign_key constaint named using constraint argument. SQL query utilized follows:
code: ALTER TABLE <schema>.<table> ADD CONSTRAINT <constraint> FOREIGN KEY (<key>) REFERENCES <foreign_table> (<foreign_key>);

title: Set Foreign Key — set_foreign_key
code: set_foreign_key(   conn,   table,   key,   foreign_table,   foreign_key = key,   constraint = paste(table, key, "fk", sep = "_") )

title: Set Foreign Key — set_foreign_key
text: conn Database connection table Table add FK constraint key Column table act key referencing foreign_key foreign_table Table reference foreign_key Column reference foreign_table constraint Name constraint created.

title: Set Foreign Key — set_foreign_key
text: SQL query

title: Set Primary Key — set_primary_key
text: Creates PRIMARY KEY constraint specified column provided table via SQL query: ALTER TABLE <schema>.<table> ADD PRIMARY KEY (<column>);.

title: Set Primary Key — set_primary_key
text: conn Database connection table Character string representing table (optional schema prefix) alter. column Character string representing column(s) add primary keys. Note multiple columns allowed create conjugate primary key.

title: Set Primary Key — set_primary_key
text: returns SQL query reference

title: Set Primary Key — set_primary_key
code: if (FALSE) { conn <- pg_connect()  # set a primary key on the table 'users' for column 'user_id': set_primary_key(conn, "users", "user_id")  }
